questions.text: I trust information that comes from direct experience more than theoretical possibilities.
When learning something new, I prefer step-by-step instructions over general concepts.
I often notice patterns and connections that others seem to miss.
I find it easier to remember specific facts than to grasp abstract theories.
I am drawn to exploring 'what could be' rather than focusing on 'what is'.
I prefer practical, hands-on activities over theoretical discussions.
I enjoy imagining future possibilities more than reflecting on past experiences.
I tend to take things at face value rather than looking for hidden meanings.
When solving problems, I start with the big picture before diving into details.
I am more interested in what is real and actual than what is possible and potential.
I often think about the symbolic or metaphorical meaning behind events.
I prefer established, proven methods over innovative but untested approaches.
